page.title: 17People of Great Orton
page.content: There are several people still living in the village who have spent all or most of their lives in the community. Talking to them, we learn what village life was like 50 years ago. It was a quiet, peaceful place with very little traffic, except the horse and cart. Skating on the village pond in winter; giving a live goose to the headmaster for his Christmas present; playing truant from school to go potato picking; annual sports days - were some customs. Many people are recent residents, having come within the last 20 years. Most are commuters to Carlisle or Wigton. But there are quite a number of senior citizens too, who have come to the village to spend their retirement. The majority of people take quite an active part in the village activities.The area has no local policeman, sharing with Thursley
